newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU still probing aspects of Krupp/Thyssen deal.
newsitem.headline: EU still probing aspects of Krupp/Thyssen deal.

text.p: The European Commission is still probing certain aspects of a joint venture between German steel companies Thyssen Stahl AG and Krupp Hoesch Stahl AG after clearing on Tuesday the pooling of their flat steel activities.

A Commission source said a separate investigation was being carried regarding the production of steel tubes, trade in fertilisers and transport services which the two companies also transferred to the joint venture called Thyssen Krupp Stahl.
The deadline for the Commission to rule on these aspects is August 11, the source said.

The Commission gave its blessing on Tuesday to the flat steel aspects of the venture under provisions in the treaty of the European Coal and Steel Community (ECSC). It did not mention the other aspects of the deal.
The source in the Commission's competition services said the other activities fell under the EU's merger control law.
The ECSC treaty applies to a range of well defined steel and coal products. The list does not include steel tubes.
